definition: a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]

sentences.english: We'll miss doing business with you.
sentences.chinese: 我們會弔唁和你一起共事的韶光。
你寫一封弔唁信表示慰問。

sentences.english: Tusk said they had been the first to offer condolences.
sentences.chinese: 圖斯克表示，他們已率先弔唁。

sentences.english: Each mourner wore a black armband and a white paper chrysanthemum .
sentences.chinese: 每個弔唁的人都佩帶着黑紗和一朵白紙菊花。

sentences.english: She requested that all the mourners blew bubbles at her funeral.
sentences.chinese: 她請求所有弔唁者都在她的葬禮上吹泡泡。

sentences.english: South Korea's president has paid tribute to 46 sailors killed last month when a warship exploded and sank near the disputed sea-border with North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 韓國總統已經弔唁46名殉職的船員在上個月。

sentences.english: Our family reached the crematorium to condole on him.
sentences.chinese: 我們全家去火葬場弔唁他的去世。

sentences.english: Many other people have lined up outside the Istana, where a book of condolence has been placed.
sentences.chinese: 很多人在總統府外排起了長隊，等待在弔唁簿上簽名。

sentences.english: Our family reached the crematorium to condole on him.
sentences.chinese: 我們全家去火葬場弔唁時。

definition: to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
